intro: Clematopsis bojeri var. pseudoscabiosifolia, commonly known as the Bojer's clematopsis, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It is a member of the Apiaceae family, characterized by its aromatic foliage and umbellate inflorescences. The plant features slender, hollow stems and has compound leaves with serrated margins. Its flowers are typically white or pale blue, attracting pollinators such as bees and butterflies. It thrives in well-drained soils and prefers full sun to partial shade.
